title: Srimad Bhagavatam - Canto 1 Chapter 2 | Teens Quiz (15Q)

questions.prompt: In SB 1.2.1, what do the sages ask Suta Gosvami to explain?
choices: The detailed history of ancient kings
The best duty for all human beings
The measurement of cosmic time cycles
questions.feedback: The sages ask about the best duty (dharma) for all people, not narrow ritual or history. The chapter begins by focusing on what truly benefits everyone spiritually.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.2, what makes devotional service the highest dharma?
choices: It brings material prosperity and comfort
It is unmotivated and uninterrupted devotion
It strictly follows complex ritual systems
questions.feedback: The verse defines topmost dharma as devotion performed without selfish motive and without interruption. This kind of devotion alone fully satisfies the self.

questions.prompt: In SB 1.2.3, what naturally develops from genuine devotional service?
questions.feedback: The verse explains that real devotion quickly brings knowledge and detachment. These qualities appear naturally when devotion is sincere.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.4, when is work considered a waste of effort?
choices: When it requires great physical labor
When it does not awaken interest in hearing about the Lord
When it does not follow social tradition
When it produces limited material results
questions.feedback: The purport explains that work has little value if it does not awaken attraction for hearing about the Lord. External success alone is not the real goal.

questions.prompt: In SB 1.2.5, what should a person do when they feel dissatisfied in life?
choices: Improve material conditions step by step
Inquire into the science of the self
questions.feedback: The verse directs dissatisfaction toward inquiry about the self and God. Real satisfaction comes from spiritual understanding, not external adjustment.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.6, what is the real purpose of religion?
choices: To increase wealth and social prestige
To bring political and social unity
To awaken devotion to the Supreme Lord
To enforce moral rules in society
questions.feedback: The purport explains that true religion must awaken devotion to the Lord. Social or moral benefits alone are not the main goal.

questions.prompt: In SB 1.2.7, devotional service must be free from which attitude?
questions.feedback: The verse explains that devotion should be free from selfish desire. Bhakti is not meant to be a tool for personal gain.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.8, what happens when devotion is pure?
choices: One gains recognition as a spiritual leader
One achieves control over natural forces
questions.feedback: Pure devotion brings immediate satisfaction to the soul. This is a sign that the soul is acting in its natural relationship with the Lord.

questions.prompt: In SB 1.2.9, how is the Supreme Lord best approached?
questions.feedback: The purport emphasizes that the Lord responds to sincere devotion, not mechanical techniques or speculation.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.10, why do material solutions fail to remove suffering?
choices: They do not address the soul's real identity
They require too much effort to maintain
They depend on unstable social systems
questions.feedback: The purport explains that suffering comes from ignorance of our spiritual identity. Material fixes cannot solve a spiritual problem.

questions.prompt: In SB 1.2.11, what is the main goal of studying Vedic knowledge?
questions.feedback: The verse states that the ultimate purpose of Vedic study is to understand the Absolute Truth, not secondary goals.

questions.prompt: Synthesis: How does SB 1.2 describe real spiritual progress?
choices: Gradually purifying the heart through devotion
questions.feedback: Across the chapter, progress is shown as purification through devotion, not external achievement or escape from duty.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.13, what is the best way to learn spiritual truth?
questions.feedback: The verse emphasizes the importance of hearing from realized devotees in a genuine teaching lineage.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.14, what practice is especially effective in Kali-yuga?
choices: Hearing and chanting about the Lord
questions.feedback: The verse highlights hearing and chanting as the most practical and effective spiritual practice for this age.

questions.prompt: Synthesis: What false idea does SB 1.2 repeatedly challenge?
choices: That religion is meant for personal benefit
That work must always be avoided
That learning scripture requires no teacher
questions.feedback: The chapter repeatedly warns against using religion for personal gain. True devotion reforms desire and brings genuine satisfaction.
